body_html: I think there might be some bugs in multiprocessing/popen_fork.py. According to this comment, HERE means what sentences program go through. It is obviously that pid, sts = os.waitpid(self.pid, flag) throw an exception which is not caught by except OSError as e:, do you have some ideas?
body_text: I think there might be some bugs in multiprocessing/popen_fork.py. According to this comment, HERE means what sentences program go through. It is obviously that pid, sts = os.waitpid(self.pid, flag) throw an exception which is not caught by except OSError as e:, do you have some ideas?
body: I think there might be some bugs in `multiprocessing/popen_fork.py`. According to [this comment](multiprocessing/popen_fork.py), `HERE` means what sentences program go through. It is obviously that `pid, sts = os.waitpid(self.pid, flag)` throw an exception which is not caught by `except OSError as e:`, do you have some ideas?
